meanings.definition: A single-celled microorganism that can cause disease or aid in digestion.
meanings.sent1: The bacterium in the water made people sick.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study bacterium to understand how it affects our bodies.
meanings.sent3: The bacterium threw a party in the stomach, but the acid was too strong!
meanings.sent4: Like a tiny army, the bacterium invaded the body, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the bacterium looked like a bustling city.

meanings.sent1: Many bacterium were found in the soil sample.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician analyzed the bacterium under a powerful microscope.
meanings.sent3: The petri dish was full of bacterium having a dance party.
meanings.sent4: The field was teeming with bacterium, like a hidden civilization.
meanings.sent5: Each of the bacterium had a specific role in the ecosystem.
